title: Apolonia Ustrzycka
text:
Princess Apolonia Poniatowski (17 January 1736 – 1814) was a Polish <a href="szlachta">noblewoman</a>, the sister-in-law of the King of Poland, <a href="Stanis%C5%82aw%20August%20Poniatowski">Stanisław August Poniatowski</a>.
She was the daughter of <a href="Bazyli%20Ustrzycki">Bazyli Ustrzycki</a> and Katarzyna Zielonka. She married Prince <a href="Antoni%20Lubomirski">Antoni Lubomirski</a> in 1749, and Prince <a href="Kazimierz%20Poniatowski">Kazimierz Poniatowski</a> on 21 January 1751.
In 1763, her brother-in-law was elected king of Poland. She became the mother of <a href="Stanis%C5%82aw%20Poniatowski%20%281754%E2%80%931833%29">Stanisław</a>, <a href="Grand%20Treasurer%20of%20Lithuania">Grand Treasurer of Lithuania</a>, and <a href="Konstancja%20Poniatowska">Konstancja Poniatowska</a>.
Her second marriage was unhappy. Her husband was known for his love life and was famously one of the clients of <a href="Henrietta%20Lullier">Henrietta Lullier</a>.
